programme.title: World Tonight
programme.desc: A wrap of the day's events in Asia, and a look-ahead at the US and Europe.(n)

programme.title: Headline News

programme.title: CNA Correspondent
programme.desc: Following the coup in Myanmar, neighbouring Thailand braces for a potential humanitarian crisis as villagers near the border flee increased violence between the military and ethnic army groups.(n)

programme.title: Talking Point
programme.desc: The global air fryer market is expected to reach US$1.2b by 2026. With more Singaporeans using air fryers, Talking Point investigates how much healthier air frying really is, compared to deep frying.(n)

programme.title: Singapore Tonight
programme.desc: From business to politics, health to technology, the latest news from Singapore and analysis of the impact.(n)

programme.title: Belly Of A Nation S2
programme.desc: COVID-19 forces Singapore into semi-lockdown. Hawkers cope with lesser footfall and the demands of religion. But from ground-up, hawkers, drivers and customers unite for the love of food.(n)

programme.title: The Longest Day
programme.desc: We meet those who are most vulnerable to extreme heat - schoolchildren in Sumba, the elderly in Singapore and slum-dwellers in Delhi - and learn how heat is a silent killer.(n)

programme.title: In Conversation
programme.desc: Renowned primatologist Jane Goodall says the disrespect for nature has caused diseases to cross over from animals to humans, like in the COVID-19 pandemic. But how will saving wildlife save humankind?(n)

programme.title: Wizards Of Tech
programme.desc: An aerial silk dancer turning waste into aerogel that can soak up oil spills. Biker buddies giving helmets Ironman-like smart displays. A bird watcher building a drone that does the work of bees.(n)
